cheatsheet.title: Create a Hello World JS Application

intro.description:
This cheat sheet shows you how to create the famous "Hello World" application and try it out. You will create a VJET project and a JavaScript File that will open a browser dialog with the text "Hello world!" when run.
If you need help at any step, click the (?) to the right. Let's get started!

item.title: Open the VJET JS perspective
item.description: If you're not already in the VJET JS perspective, in the main menu select Window > Open Perspective > VJET JS or click on the "Click to Perform" link below.

item.title: Create a VJET JS Project
item.description: Before creating a JavaScript File, we need a project to put it in. In the main toolbar, click on the New VJET JS Project button, or click on the link below. Enter HelloBrowser for the project name, then click Finish.

item.title: Create your HelloWorld Js File
item.description:
The next step is to create a new JS file In the main toolbar again, click on the New JavaScript Source File button (or the link below). If not already specified, select HelloBrowser/src as the source folder. Enter HelloBrowser for the file name, then click Finish.
The VJET JS editor will automatically open showing your new JavaScript file

item.title: Add a print statement
Run your VJET JS application
item.description:
To run your application, right-click on your js file in the Script Explorer and select Run As > VJET Browser Application. The Console view should appear at the bottom and display the "Hello, browser!" output.
Congratulations! You have successfully created a Hello Browser application!
